ext_descriptions.ext_description: An annotation_occurrence defines occurrences of annotation by combining two--dimensional geometry or annotation elements with style for presentation purposes. See clause \ref{presentation appearance schema} for more detail about assigning style. Annotation_occurrences shall be used only in s which are defined for annotation purposes, i.e., , , , , or .
A annotation_occurrence shall be a .
An annotation_point_occurrence is a with a style assignment.
The styled item shall be a .
An annotation_curve_occurrence is a with a style assignment.
The styled item shall be a .
An annotation_fill_area_occurrence is the assignment of a style to an ; it includes the specification of the point to be used as the starting point of the fill_area.
the point that specifies the starting location for the fill\_\-area\_\-style assigned to the annotation\_\-fill\_\-area\_\-occurrence.
The styled item shall be an .
An annotation_text_occurrence is a , , , , or with a style assignment.
The item to which style is assigned shall be the type of at least one of , , , , or .
An annotation_symbol_occurrence is an with a style assignment or a with a style assignment.
The styled item shall be an or a .
An annotation_table_occurrence is an with a style assignment or a with a style assignment.
The styled item shall be an or a .

An annotation_occurrence_relationship is the association of two s.
\newpage
There is no significance to the ordering of the two related s. The use of the different attribute names serves only to distinguish the names.
the first of two s which are related.
text that relates the nature of the annotation_occurrence_relationship. }{O/E1}
the word, or group of words, by which the annotation_occurrence_relationship is referred to.
the second of two s which are related.
A table_text_relationship establishes a relationship between a field in an and an . It is used to include text in a field of a table.
The relating_annotation_occurrence shall present an .
The related_annotation_occurrence shall be an .
the in which text is positioned.
the particular field in the table in which the text is positioned.
The relating_annotation_occurrence shall be an .
The field shall be a field in the table in which the text is positioned.
the positioned in the table.

The acyclic_composite_text function examines a instance to see if it participates in its own definition. It returns TRUE if the instance is acyclic (does not participate in its own definition) and FALSE if it is cyclic (does participate in its own definition).
The function first checks to see if it is among its own collected_text set, and returns FALSE if it is. Next, it creates a local set of all instances of in its own collected_text set. It then adds to this set all of the instances of that are referenced by the used by the used by any in its own collected_text set. This local set is added to the set of instances already examined. If the set of instances already examined does not increase in size, then all possibilities have been examined and the function returns TRUE. Otherwise, the function is then called recursively to check further.
the which is tested. This is input to the function.
the s referenced by start_composite. This is input to the function. On initial input this set contains as its only element the collected_text of the start_composite.
The acyclic_symbol_representation_relationship function determines if a is used in the tree of s that defines this . It returns TRUE if it is not acyclic, and FALSE if there is.
the which is tested. This is input to the function.
the s referenced by relation. This is input to the function. On initial input this set contains as only element the rep_2 of the relation.

The field_in_table function is a function that examines a and an , and returns the value TRUE if the field is in the table, and FALSE if the field is not in the table.
The function first finds the that the maps. It then finds all the s which are either related to the table_representation_entity by a or are included in the through a . Finally, it returns FALSE if there are no entities which relate to the field by a or include the field through a , and returns TRUE otherwise.
the annotation table which shall contain the field. This is input to the function.
the table record field which shall be in the table. This is input to the function.

The text_delineation type is provided to control the delineation of text.
Application protocols may specify legal values of text_delineation and associate precise meaning with those values.
An application protocol may specify that the only permitted values of this type are 'underline' and 'overline', and associate these with the delineation of text as shown in figure 1.
Examples of text delineation
The defined_symbol_select specifies the implicit description of a .
The text_or_character specifies the items which can be used in an or a .

The text_alignment is provided to control the alignment of text.
Application protocols shall specify legal values of the text_alignment and shall associate precise meaning with those values.
An Application Protocol may specify that the only permitted values of this type are 'left', 'centre' and 'right', and associate these to the positioning of text with respect to alignment points as shown in figure 1.
Examples of text alignment
The defined_glyph_select is a selection between a and an .

The text_path specifies the direction of the location of the next text character relative to the current character. The next text character can appear to the left of the current character, to the right of the current character, above the current character, or below the current character.
the next character is placed to the right of the current character.
the next character is placed to the left of the current character.
the next character is placed above the current character.
the next character is placed below the current character.

An annotation_fill_area is a type of . An annotation_fill_area is a set of curves that may be filled with hatching, shading, colour, or tiling. The annotation_fill_area is described by boundaries which consist of non-intersecting, non-self-intersecting closed curves. These curves form the boundary of planar areas to be filled according to the style for the annotation_fill_area. The filling is defined by the following rules:
rve that is not surrounded by any other curve is a border between an unfilled area on the outside and a filled area on the inside. see figure 1 a).
rve surrounds an unfilled area if it is surrounded by another curve whose inside is a filled area. see figure 1 b).
third curve is placed inside of the second curve this curve surrounds a filled area. see figure 1 c).
each additional curve the procedure is applied in the same manner.
Filling of annotation fill areas
a set of curves that define the boundaries of the fill area.

ext_description.p: All the curves in the set boundaries shall be closed and planar.
If there are two or more curves in the set boundaries,all of these curves shall be coplanar, and no two curves shall intersect each other.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A defined_symbol is a type of . A defined_symbol is a symbol that has an implicit definition, either through a or an .
a description of the scaling, placement, and orientation of the defined_symbol.
an implicit description of a symbol, either pre-defined or externally defined.

A defined_table is a type of
that specifies an implicit definition of a table.

A symbol_target is a type of . A symbol_target is the target of the transformation which determines the location and orientation of a
used as an , or the target of a . It consists of an oriented position and a scaling in x and y.
the scale applied to the y coordinates of the or of the .
the scale applied to the x coordinates of the or of the .
the location and orientation of a or of a used as an .

A pre_defined_symbol is a type of
A pre_defined_symbol allows a conforming exchange to define an application-specific symbol. The actual symbol shall be defined by an Application Protocol.
An externally_defined_symbol is an that makes an external reference to a symbol.

An annotation_symbol is the mapping of a as a to present that as part of a picture.
Figure fig_annotation_symbol shows examples of annotation symbols.
Examples of annotation symbols
%
a indicating where the symbol is to be placed.
The mapping_target shall be a .
An instance of annotation_symbol shall also be an instance of .
The mapping_source shall be a .
a which maps the
An annotation_table is the mapping of a to present the as part of a picture.
The that is mapped shall be a .
The symbol_representation_map is a which maps a to an .
The mapping_origin shall be an .
the to be included in an .
The mapped_representation shall be a .
an defining the origin of the mapping.

A symbol_representation is a kind of used in the assembly of a symbol. It allows also the definition of {annotation\_\-table}s which are a specialization of s. Symbol_representations may only be related to each other using s.
The symbol_representation_with_blanking_box is a that includes a box which blanks out all other elements in the box.
a box which blanks out any element in the box with exception of the symbol itself.
The blanking box shall be in the context SELF.context_of_items.

A table_representation is a kind of symbol used for creating tables. Table_representations may only be related with entities. If a table_representation plays the role of rep_1 in a , only a nexp{table_record_representation} may play the role of rep_2.

A table_record_representation is a kind of symbol used for creating records within tables. Table_record_representations may only be related by s. If a table_record_representation plays the role of rep_1 in a , only a may play the role of rep_2.
Either a table_record_representation shall be used as a rep_2 in a , or it shall be mapped into a .

A table_record_field_representation is a kind of symbol used for creating fields within records of a table. Table_record_field_representations may only be related by entities. If a table_record_field_representation plays the role of rep_1 in a , only a table_record_field_representation may play the role of rep_2.
Either a table_record_field_representation shall be used as a rep_2 in a , or it shall be mapped into a .
A table_record_field_representation_with_clipping_box is a which includes a clipping box to blank out all elements outside of the box.
The clipping_box shall be in the same context as the table_record_field_representation_with_clipping_box.
a that defines the boundary for clipping the contents of the .
A symbol_representation_relationship is a kind of used to relate s.
a that plays the role of a parent (root) in a tree of s.

The rep_2 attribute of a symbol_representation_relationship shall be a.
The attributes rep_1 and rep_2 are defined in ISO~10303-43.
a that plays the role of a child (leaf) in a tree of s.
A symbol_representation_relationship shall not participate in a tree of s where the root of the tree is also a leaf of its own tree.
The table_representation_relationship is a kind of used to relate s, s, and s.
If a plays the role of SELF$backslash$representation_relationship.rep_1, then a shall play the role of SELF$backslash$representation_relationship.rep_2.
If a plays the role of SELF$backslash$representation_relationship.rep_1, then a shall play the role of SELF$backslash$representation_relationship.rep_2.
If a plays the role of SELF$backslash$representation_relationship.rep_1, then a shall play the role of SELF$backslash$representation_relationship.rep_2.

An annotation_text is the mapping of a a which contains , , , or annotation_text entities as a to present that as part of a picture. This structure allows an annotation_text to be a simple string of characters, a collection of strings, or a more complex collection of strings and characters.
an which positions and orients the annotation_text_map.
The mapped_representation shall be a .
An instance of annotation_text shall also be an instance of .
The mapping_target shall be an .
a which maps the that supplies text, characters, or text_literal_symbols for the annotation_text.
An annotation_text_with_extent is an whose extent is explicitly specified.
the extent of the in x and y directions of the local coordinate system defined by the attribute.
The annotation_text_with_delineation is an that specifies the delineation of the text. The type of delineation and its effect on the appearance of the text is specified in an Application Protocol.
the specification of the delineation to be applied to the text.
An annotation_text_with_associated_curves is an that contains one ore more s.

a set of s associated with the .
If the s associated with an annotation_text_with_associated_curves are to be presented, then they may be assigned style by .
A text_string_representation is a which has a collection of text strings and characters to be mapped to an entity.
The text_string_representation shall contain one or more , , , or .
Each shall be the mapping_target of an or an in the text_string_representation.
an items set redefined to be the set of strings and the placement.
Each item in the text_string_representation shall be an , an , a , a , or an .
An annotation_text_character is a which has a character as its mapping_source. That character is a glyph that exists within a conforming exchange.
an which is the target of the mapping transformation.
The target of the annotation_text_character shall be an .
The annotation_text_character shall be a .
the specification of the point by which the character is located.
The source of the annotation_text_character shall be a .
the character glyph that exists within a conforming exchange.
A defined_character_glyph is a character glyph that has an implicit definition, either through a or an .
an implicit description of a character glyph, either pre--defined or externally defined.
a description of the placement and orientation of the character glyph.
An externally_defined_character_glyph is an that makes an external reference to a character glyph.
A pre_defined_character_glyph allows a conforming exchange to define an application--specific character glyph. The actual character glyph shall be defined by an Application Protocol.
A text_literal is a definition of a text string using a string literal.
the text literal to be presented.
the alignment of the text literal relative to its position.
the writing direction of the text literal.

an which determines the position and orientation of the presented string. The y axis is taken as reference direction for and .
If both box_rotation_angle and are zero the baseline of each character box is parallel to the x axis and the upright direction of each character box is parallel to the y axis. See figure fig_slant_angle.
the pre--defined or externally defined font which shall be used for presenting the text_literal.
A text_literal_with_extent is a whose extent is explicitly specified.
the extent in x and y direction of the text_literal_symbol.
A text_literal_with_delineation is a that specifies the delineation of the text. The type of delineation and its effect on the appearance of the text is specified in an Application Protocol.
the specification of the delineation to be applied to the text.
A text_literal_with_associated_curves is a that contains one ore more s.

a set of s associated with the .
If the s associated with a text_literal_with_associated_curves are to be presented, then they may be assigned style by .
A composite_text is a collection of , , , , or other composite_text that may be placed and styled as a collection.
the set of , , , or other composite_text that may be placed and styled as a collection.
A composite text shall not participate in its own definition.
A composite_text_with_extent is a whose extent is explicitly specified.
the extent in x and y directions of the composite_text_with_extent.
A composite_text_with_delineation is a that specifies the delineation of the text. The type of delineation and its effect on the appearance of the text is specified in an Application Protocol.
the specification of the delineation to be applied to the text.
An composite_text_with_blanking_box is a that contains a blanking box.
a that defines a rectangular area within which only the is presented.
A composite_text_with_associated_curves is a that contains one ore more s.

a set of s associated with the .
If the s associated with a composite_curve_with_associated_curves are to be presented, then they may be assigned style by .

The styled item shall be an or a .
An annotation_table_occurrence is an with a style assignment or a with a style assignment.

The function first checks to see if it is among its own collected_text set, and returns FALSE if it is. Next, it creates a local set of all instances of in its own collected_text set. It then adds to this set all of the instances of that are referenced by the used by the used by any in its own collected_text set. This local set is added to the set of instances already examined. If the set of instances already examined does not increase in size, then all possibilities have been examined and the function returns TRUE. Otherwise, the function is then called recursively to check further.
the which is tested. This is input to the function.
the s referenced by start_composite. This is input to the function. On initial input this set contains as its only element the collected_text of the start_composite.

the which is tested. This is input to the function.

The field_in_table function is a function that examines a and an , and returns the value TRUE if the field is in the table, and FALSE if the field is not in the table.
The function first finds the that the maps. It then finds all the s which are either related to the table_representation_entity by a or are included in the through a . Finally, it returns FALSE if there are no entities which relate to the field by a or include the field through a , and returns TRUE otherwise.
the annotation table which shall contain the field. This is input to the function.
